supporting_text: The NAP emphasises the importance of tackling AMR through a One Health approach.
The NAP includes specific actions in the human health sector, including infection prevention and control standards.
The NAP includes specific actions targeting animal health, such as improving on-farm biosecurity measures.
The NAP includes actions related to environmental standards and biosecurity.
The NAP includes actions aimed at improving agricultural practices and biosecurity measures.
The NAP mentions the need for monitoring and evaluation frameworks to assess progress.
The document does not specify time-bound targets.
The NAP does not provide specific quantitative targets for AMR prevalence.
The NAP does not mention specific budget allocations.
The NAP does not assess future budget requirements.
The NAP emphasizes maintaining linkages and opportunities between stakeholders across all sectors.
The NAP includes monitoring and reviewing regulatory measures relevant to antimicrobial usage.
The NAP includes strategies to drive education and training initiatives across all relevant sectors.
The NAP includes a coordinated communication strategy to support awareness and behavioural change.
The NAP emphasizes participation in international forums and collaboration with global organizations.
The NAP includes creating a national One Health surveillance system that integrates data across sectors.
The NAP includes actions to improve understanding of antimicrobial resistance and its implications.
The NAP includes strategies for infection prevention and control across various health settings.
The NAP emphasizes the need to align with international standards for AMR control.
The NAP includes actions to strengthen regulation of antimicrobial usage.
The NAP includes strategies to promote appropriate antimicrobial use and stewardship.
The NAP includes actions to support innovative research and development in AMR.
